alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 25 at 8:13AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. .Snowmelt yesterday combined with recent rainfall has resulted in river levels rising to flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding is beginning to occur. * WHERE...Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, County Road FX begins to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...A forecast will be issued by this afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 1200 PM EDT.
